content.description: Crouch start with a so-so right hand crimp in the seam and a left sidepull crimp. Climb the obvious series of pinches and slopes.
content.location: This is on the second Bob Johnson Boulder about 7-8 feet right of the problem The Ramp.

content.description:
Sit start on the left side of the face with your hands on a good ledge. Take the easy way to the crack system above. Climb the crack near the top in either direction. 

  This is located on Bob Johnson Boulder #2.
content.protection: A pad, or a bolt at the top of the rock.

content.description: Sit start using the ramp for feet, and crank straight up.
content.location: This is on the second Bob Johnson Boulder. Walk around the boulder until you see the ramp, then sit down, and grab a low, left, hueco sidepull.

content.description: Sit start and dyno to a flake and then top out straight up with difficulty.
content.location: This is on the second Bob Johnson Boulder about 3-4 feet right of Vapor.

content.description: Sit start as for the problem Bloodhound, but instead of climbing straight up, move right to a really crimpy, shallow hueco and then up.Â
Sit or stand start the face to the left of Totality. Mantel onto the large shelf. From the large shelf, mantel onto the top.
content.protection: A pad? There is a bolt at the top if you want to protect the finish.

content.description:
Sit start on the abutting boulder a couple feet off the ground. Use sidepulls and friction to traverse up and to the right to gain the ledge. 

  There is an extension from the start holds of Totality. Traverse using crimps and friction to add length to Corona. The extension goes a bit harder at V3+.
content.protection: The trees provide an escape. There is no good place for a pad.
content.location: It is on Bob Johnson Boulder #2.

content.description: On the second Bob Johnson Boulder, sit start on a jug and sniff out the depressing holds that lead to a sketchy topout.

This boulder is 20' or so at its highest and is probably 30' in diameter. There are a few bolts at the top if you want to set up a toprope. Most of the faces are overhung, but there are two slab/vertical faces and featured aretes. There is a large blank section with minimal features with a nice overhang. There might be enough for something very hard, though!
